article: As a teenager, I felt I couldn't always make people happy. I was rebellious outside, but I wanted to be  _  inside. Once I left home to hitch-hike to California with my friend Penelope. And my family seemed to like her better than me.1 wondered if I would be  _  if I wasn't there. I told my mom, and she explained  _  Penelope was a lovely girl, no one could take my place. I pointed out, "She is more patient and neater than I have ever been." My mom said these were wonderful  _  ,but I was a loved member of the family who couldn't be replaced even with my faults . I became a searcher, wanting to find out wh0 1 was and what made me so special. My view of myself was  _  .I came to feel much more sure that no one can ever take my position.
